title: NewJeans Are Headed For The Best Anniversary Present Ever - Forbes
articleBody: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin TOKYO, JAPAN - APRIL 06:  (L-R) HYEIN, HAERIN, HANNI, MINJI and DANIELLE of K-pop group NewJeans ... [+] attend the photocall for MUSINSA Pop-up Store Opening Ceremony on April 6, 2023 in Tokyo, Japan.  (Photo by Jun Sato/WireImage) WireImage South Korean girl group NewJeans is on the brink of celebrating their first year in the music industry, and it seems like a spectacular present is in store for this milestone. The band's new EP, Get Up , is generating immense buzz and is predicted to achieve a remarkable featâ€”claiming the coveted No. 1 spot on the Billboard 200. The Billboard 200 chart ranks the most-consumed albums and EPs in the U.S. on a weekly basis, and NewJeans' Get Up is expected to make a grand entrance. Music industry publication HitsDailyDouble forecasts that the EP is likely to debut atop the Billboard 200 with an impressive 130,000 equivalent units, with a substantial portion of those being pure purchasesâ€”perhaps exceeding 100,000 units. Although NewJeans faces competition from the recently released Barbie soundtrack, which is projected to open in second, the closeness of the race remains to be seen. MORE FROM FORBES NewJeans Beats One Of Blackpink's Most Impressive Records By Hugh McIntyre Get Up is poised to mark not only NewJeans' first No. 1 on the Billboard 200 but also their first top 10 win. This achievement is remarkable considering that the group has not yet made an appearance on the chart before. The lead single from the EP, â€œSuper Shy,â€ has already made its debut on the Hot 100 chart, entering at No. 64 this week. With the full collection set to make its mark on various Billboard charts, it is highly likely that other tracks from the project will follow suit and find their place among the most-consumed songs in the country. MORE FOR YOU The Best Places To Buy Engagement Rings That Truly Shine Billboard is expected to announce the EP's chart-topping success just a day or so before the one-year anniversary of NewJeans's entrance into the music industry. The group made their debut with an EP titled New Jeans on August 1, 2022. Their single album, titled OMG , released earlier in 2023, produced more hits. MORE FROM FORBES BTS's Jung Kook Ties NewJeans With His Latest Global Smash Single By Hugh McIntyre
summary: South Korean girl group NewJeans is on the brink of celebrating their first year in the music industry. The group is set to celebrate their first anniversary in Japan with a pop-up store opening ceremony in Tokyo. The event will take place on April 6, 2023 in Tokyo, Japan.

title: Multiple Threats To Kill Women At Sillim Station Surface Online ... - Koreaboo
articleBody: On July 21, KST, Seoul witnessed a terrible tragedy as a man stabbed four strangers at the Sillim subway station in Seoul. One of the victims passed away, while the other three sustained serious injuries. Beverages and flowers left at Sillim Station to pay respects to the victim who lost his life to the stabbing | Yonhap News Later, the police arrested the perpetrator, a man in his 30s. On July 26, they revealed his identity to the public, with his name, Cho Sun, and a picture of his face disclosed. Police revealed the perpetratorâ€™s picture to the public | Yonhap News In less than a week of this incident, another threat at Sillim Station surfaced online. On July 25, around 10 pm (KST), a post was uploaded on an online forum where the writer threatened to â€œ rape and murder women near Sillim Station. â€ It was later deleted, but not before the police got notified. Upon receiving the report, the police sent a total of 11 patrol vehicles to search the area, but they found no signs of the threatened crime. The Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency is said to be still tracking the writer. This is, however, not the first online threat to surface after the stabbing rampage at Sillim Station. On Tuesday, July 25, police put a man in his 20s under emergency detention on suspicions of uploadingÂ an online post the previous day threatening to â€œ kill 20 women at Sillim Station on Wednesday. â€Â The poster used the wordÂ â€œ hannyeo,â€ which is a derogatory term used to describe Korean women in certain anti-feminist communities.
